channel.title: Home on R-Ladies Lausanne
channel.description: Recent content in Home on R-Ladies Lausanne

item.title: Another Note on A blogdown Tutorial
item.description: I just discovered an awesome tutorial on blogdown written by Alison. I have to admit this is the best blogdown tutorial I have seen so far.

item.title: A Quick Note on Two Beautiful Websites
item.description: To me, the two most impressive websites based on blogdown are: Rob J Hyndman’s personal website. Live Free or Dichotomize by Lucy and Nick et al. I’m sure there will be more.

item.title: About R-Ladies & R-Ladies Lausanne
item.description: R-Ladies is a world-wide organization to promote gender diversity in the R community. R-Ladies Global Check here. Chapters There are plenty of chapters around the world, listed here. Find material on other chapters meetups on github repository (search for meetup-presentations_TOWN). Remote R-Ladies Remote R-Ladies Lausanne The chapter in Lauanne was founded in November 2017. We are currently four organisers: Andrea Komljenovic Ninon Mounier Sarvenaz Choobdar Sina Rüeger Contact You can contact us via lausanne@rladies.

item.title: Community
item.description: Come to our meetups! Bring R-Problem, listen. Suggest speakers Speakers As we always need R speakers for meetups, please get in touch with us at lausanne at rladies.org. Mentor or Sponsor

item.title: Events
item.description: We have a meetup roughly every second month. The content of our meetups varies: A mix of short talks of 5-20 minutes on a range of topics. For example: Favourite R packages, Applications for which you use R, The best way to learn R. This is an excellent opportunity for everyone to present what they are passionate about. How-tos/Tutorials of R-packages and applications. Are you an experienced in an R-related-topic that you would like to share and others to learn?
